bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Guillermo Garcia Lopez, February 22, 1952

div1.p: Hench thanks Lopez for the courtesies shown to the him during the recent Havana congress. Hench enjoyed the meeting very much, even though vitamins and nutrition are not his field.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Guillermo Garcia Lopez, February 22, 1952
div1.opener:
February 22, 1952
Dr. Guillermo Garcia Lopez
4 No. 512 entre 21 y 23
Vedado, Havana, Cuba
My dear Doctor Garcia:
div1.p:
I am just recovering from a nasty cold that
I caught on the train coming home.

I wish to thank you most sincerely for the
many kindnesses and courtesies which you and
your colleagues extended to Mrs. Hench and
me during our recent visit to Havana.

I thought the Congress was a great success
and I enjoyed it very much even though
vitamins and nutrition are not my field.
I do hope you and your colleagues thought it
was a success.

Tom Spies has been a delightful friend of
mine and I am very grateful indeed to him
and to you all for inviting me.
div1.closer: Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:alc
